required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: First Line Metastatic Colorectal Cancer Therapy in Combination With FOLFOX
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Double-blind, Multicentre Phase II/III Study to Compare the Efficacy of Cediranib (RECENTIN™, AZD2171) in Combination With 5-fluorouracil, Leucovorin, and Oxaliplatin (FOLFOX), to the Efficacy of Bevacizumab in Combination With FOLFOX in Patients With Previously Untreated Metastatic Colorectal Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see if Cediranib in combination with FOLFOX is effective in treating metastatic colorectal cancer and to see how it compares with Avastin (Bevacizumab) in combination with FOLFOX.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline then at Weeks 8, 16, 24 and then every 12 weeks until progression
primary_outcome.description: Progression is defined as the number of months from randomisation until progressive disease based on RECIST (progression of target lesions, clear progression of existing non-target lesions or the appearance of one or more new lesions) or death in the absence of progression.

secondary_outcome.description: Number of months from randomisation to the date of death from any cause

Objective response rate is Complete Response (CR) + Partial Response (PR) as defined below: CR = Disappearance of all target lesions. PR = At least a 30% decrease in the sum of longest diameters (LDs) of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum of LDs.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up until data cut-off date of 15/11/2007
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of Response is calculated as the time from the first recording of CR/PR until the patient progresses, regardless of whether the patient was still taking study medication. Only confirmed responses are included in the calculation. For patients who had not progressed, the end date used in the calculation of duration of response is the data cut-off date of 15th November 2009.
Percentage change in tumour size from baseline to first RECIST assessment (Week 8) ((Week 8 - baseline)/baseline)*100

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Worsening of Health Related Quality of Life (QOL) Based on the FACT Colorectal Symptom Index (FCSI)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to worsening of symptoms, as measured by the FACT colorectal symptom index (FCSI), will be defined as the time when a sustained clinically important deterioration in the total score from the FCSI has been recorded.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical Diagnosis of colon or rectal cancer
- No prior systemic therapy for metastatic disease. Any adjuvant/neoadjuvant oxaliplatin therapy must have been received >12 months prior to study entry and adjuvant/neoadjuvant 5-FU must have been received >6 months prior to study entry.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior treatment with a VEGF Inhibitor, including bevacizumab and cediranib.
- Poorly controlled hypertension

link.description: AstraZeneca Information - Outside of the US

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Enrolled = 1814 though not all patient randomised. Randomised= Intent to treat (ITT): Cediranib 20mg 709, Cediranib 30mg 192 Bevacizumab 713; Safety: Cediranib 20mg 705, Cediranib 30mg 191 Bevacizumab 704
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Cediranib 30mg discontinued following Phase II, Cediranib 20mg chosen dose for comparing with Bevacizumab. 200 patients dropped prior to treatment. Study was set up as a phase II/III study. Participants were enrolled into both phases if they participated in both Phase II/III, but are only counted once in the Enrollment Number and in the Results.

group.title: Cediranib 20 mg
group.description: Cediranib 20 mg/day + FOLFOX The FOLFOX regimen in this study was a modified FOLFOX6 regimen, repeated every 2 weeks: Oxaliplatin 85 mg/m2 with leucovorin 400 mg/m2 (or equivalent folinic acid preparation) administered intravenously over 2 hours on Day 1 5-FU 400 mg/m2 bolus immediately after completion of the oxaliplatin infusion on Day 1, followed immediately by 5-FU 2400 mg/m2 administered by a continuous iv infusion over 46 hours.

group.title: Bevacizumab 5 mg/kg
group.description: Bevacizumab 5 mg/kg on Day 1 and every 2 weeks + FOLFOX The FOLFOX regimen in this study was a modified FOLFOX6 regimen, repeated every 2 weeks: Oxaliplatin 85 mg/m2 with leucovorin 400 mg/m2 (or equivalent folinic acid preparation) administered intravenously over 2 hours on Day 1 5-FU 400 mg/m2 bolus immediately after completion of the oxaliplatin infusion on Day 1, followed immediately by 5-FU 2400 mg/m2 administered by a continuous iv infusion over 46 hours.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Progression Free Survival
outcome.description: Progression is defined as the number of months from randomisation until progressive disease based on RECIST (progression of target lesions, clear progression of existing non-target lesions or the appearance of one or more new lesions) or death in the absence of progression.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline then at Weeks 8, 16, 24 and then every 12 weeks until progression
outcome.population: Two cediranib doses (20 mg and 30 mg) were initially included in this study; however, it was intended that one dose would be selected for continuation. The decision was taken to continue with cediranib 20 mg. No statistical analyses were performed on the 30mg group.

measure.title: Progression Free Survival
measure.description: Progression is defined as the number of months from randomisation until progressive disease based on RECIST (progression of target lesions, clear progression of existing non-target lesions or the appearance of one or more new lesions) or death in the absence of progression.
measure.population: Two cediranib doses (20 mg and 30 mg) were initially included in this study; however, it was intended that one dose would be selected for continuation. The decision was taken to continue with cediranib 20 mg. No statistical analyses were performed on the 30mg group.

outcome.title: Overall Survival
outcome.description: Number of months from randomisation to the date of death from any cause
outcome.population: Two cediranib doses (20 mg and 30 mg) were initially included in this study; however, it was intended that one dose would be selected for continuation. The decision was taken to continue with cediranib 20 mg. No statistical analyses were performed on the 30mg group.

outcome.description: Objective response rate is Complete Response (CR) + Partial Response (PR) as defined below: CR = Disappearance of all target lesions. PR = At least a 30% decrease in the sum of longest diameters (LDs) of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum of LDs.

measure.title: Objective Response Rate
measure.description: Objective response rate is Complete Response (CR) + Partial Response (PR) as defined below: CR = Disappearance of all target lesions. PR = At least a 30% decrease in the sum of longest diameters (LDs) of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum of LDs.
measure.population: Two cediranib doses (20 mg and 30 mg) were initially included in this study; however, it was intended that one dose would be selected for continuation. The decision was taken to continue with cediranib 20 mg. No statistical analyses were performed on the 30mg group.

outcome.title: Duration of Response
outcome.description: Duration of Response is calculated as the time from the first recording of CR/PR until the patient progresses, regardless of whether the patient was still taking study medication. Only confirmed responses are included in the calculation. For patients who had not progressed, the end date used in the calculation of duration of response is the data cut-off date of 15th November 2009.

outcome.population: Two cediranib doses (20 mg and 30 mg) were initially included in this study; however, it was intended that one dose would be selected for continuation. The decision was taken to continue with cediranib 20 mg. No statistical analyses were performed on the 30mg group.

measure.title: Duration of Response
measure.description: Duration of Response is calculated as the time from the first recording of CR/PR until the patient progresses, regardless of whether the patient was still taking study medication. Only confirmed responses are included in the calculation. For patients who had not progressed, the end date used in the calculation of duration of response is the data cut-off date of 15th November 2009.
measure.population: Two cediranib doses (20 mg and 30 mg) were initially included in this study; however, it was intended that one dose would be selected for continuation. The decision was taken to continue with cediranib 20 mg. No statistical analyses were performed on the 30mg group.

outcome.title: Percentage Change in Tumour Size
outcome.description: Percentage change in tumour size from baseline to first RECIST assessment (Week 8) ((Week 8 - baseline)/baseline)*100
outcome.population: No statistical analyses were performed on the 30mg group. Patients had to have both a baseline and post-baseline (week 8) value to be included in the analysis. If patients did not have a week 8 assessment they were not included.

group.title: Cediranib 20 mg
group.description: Cediranib 20 mg/day + FOLFOX The FOLFOX regimen in this study was a modified FOLFOX6 regimen, repeated every 2 weeks: Oxaliplatin 85 mg/m2 with leucovorin 400 mg/m2 (or equivalent folinic acid preparation) administered intravenously over 2 hours on Day 1 5-FU 400 mg/m2 bolus immediately after completion of the oxaliplatin infusion on Day 1, followed immediately by 5-FU 2400 mg/m2 administered by a continuous iv infusion over 46 hours.

group.description: Bevacizumab 5 mg/kg on Day 1 and every 2 weeks + FOLFOX The FOLFOX regimen in this study was a modified FOLFOX6 regimen, repeated every 2 weeks: Oxaliplatin 85 mg/m2 with leucovorin 400 mg/m2 (or equivalent folinic acid preparation) administered intravenously over 2 hours on Day 1 5-FU 400 mg/m2 bolus immediately after completion of the oxaliplatin infusion on Day 1, followed immediately by 5-FU 2400 mg/m2 administered by a continuous iv infusion over 46 hours.

measure.title: Percentage Change in Tumour Size
measure.description: Percentage change in tumour size from baseline to first RECIST assessment (Week 8) ((Week 8 - baseline)/baseline)*100
measure.population: No statistical analyses were performed on the 30mg group. Patients had to have both a baseline and post-baseline (week 8) value to be included in the analysis. If patients did not have a week 8 assessment they were not included.

outcome.title: Time to Worsening of Health Related Quality of Life (QOL) Based on the FACT Colorectal Symptom Index (FCSI)
outcome.description: Time to worsening of symptoms, as measured by the FACT colorectal symptom index (FCSI), will be defined as the time when a sustained clinically important deterioration in the total score from the FCSI has been recorded.

group.title: 1Bevacizumab 5mg/kg
group.description: Bevacizumab 5 mg/kg on Day 1 and every 2 weeks

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a Study Site, or an investigator, requests permission to publish data from this study, any such publication (including oral presentations) is to be agreed with AstraZeneca prior to publication.
